dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 5629 IH: Strengthening Domestic Nuclear Security Act of 2014
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Meehan (for himself and Mr. McCaul) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Homeland Security

form.official-title: To amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to strengthen the Domestic Nuclear Detection Office, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Strengthening Domestic Nuclear Security Act of 2014
.

section.header: Domestic implementation of the global nuclear detection architecture
section.text: In carrying out the mission of the Office under subparagraph (A) of section 1902(a)(4), the Director for Domestic Nuclear Detection shall provide support for planning, organization, equipment, training, exercises, and operational assessments to Federal, State, local, territorial, and tribal entities to assist in implementing radiological and nuclear detection capabilities in the event of a radiological or nuclear act of terror or other attack. Such capabilities shall be integrated into the enhanced global nuclear detection architecture referred to in such section 1902(a)(4), and shall inform and be guided by architecture studies, technology needs, and research activities of the Office.

subsection.text: The Director for Domestic Nuclear Detection shall establish the Securing the Cities (STC) program to enhance, through Federal, State, local, tribal, and private entities, the ability of the United States to detect and prevent a radiological or nuclear act of terror or other attack in high-risk urban areas.

In designating jurisdiction under subsection (a), the Director for Domestic Nuclear Detection shall consider jurisdictions designated by the Secretary as high-risk urban areas under section 2003, and other cities and regions as appropriate, for the selection of new STC locations.

The Director for Domestic Nuclear Detection shall notify the Committee on Homeland Security and the Committee on Appropriations of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs and the Committee on Appropriations of the Senate not later than 30 days after any additions or changes to the jurisdictions participating in the STC program under this section.

Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this section, the Comptroller General of the United States shall submit to the congressional committees specified in subsection (c) an assessment, including an evaluation of the effectiveness, of the STC program.

text.cato:entity: There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this title $291,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2015 and 2016.

subsection.text: The table of contents in section 1(b) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended by striking the item relating to section 1907 and inserting the following new items:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 1907. Joint biennial interagency review of global nuclear detection architecture.
Sec. 1908. Domestic implementation of the global nuclear detection architecture.

subsection.text: This Act shall take effect on the date that is 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
